channel.title: I is be needing rig
channel.description:
Yeah well I'm getting a gaming rig together and I'm trying to stay under or at $700.00
This is what I has so fars
CPU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103773 [79.99]
GPU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814125291 [179.99]
HDD - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136039 [64.99]
Optical drive - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817707134 [59.99]
Case - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811129042 [54.95]
Mobo - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813131398 [99.99]
Ram - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231166 [59.99]
OS - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16837116194 [89.99]
So far that is 689.88 and lets say $700.00 w/ shipping.
Anyone have any ideas of any better upgrades? [Would be willing to go up to $750 for a quad core excluding my dual core]
Edit: Also, anyone know what I can do with an old 300w power supply? I don't think I can sell it..

item.title: I is be needing rig
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

zyle1992:

Question: If you have 8 gigs of RAM in your box, does windows only recognize ~4 of it?

If your running 64 bit it will recognize all 8

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

OR just download the disk images onto 6 floppys. GOing to try it tomorrow, but should be the same as the disk. OR you could find someone with winnt32.exe SUpposedly it’s the “starting-over” program. Not sure how to use it though.

Question: If you have 8 gigs of RAM in your box, does windows only recognize ~4 of it?

item.title: I is be needing rig
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:26, topic:300396”]If you get a 32bit OS then not only will it cut off at 3.6GB, but each program can only use 1 or 2 GB of it at a time. With a 64 bit, you’re not limited by the amount of RAM for a long time but programs can also use as much of it as you want, say 5GB of 6GB.[/quote]4gb - vram

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

32 bit windows os*

Read full topic

item.title: I is be needing rig
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

If you get a 32bit OS then not only will it cut off at 3.6GB, but each program can only use 1 or 2 GB of it at a time. With a 64 bit, you’re not limited by the amount of RAM for a long time but programs can also use as much of it as you want, say 5GB of 6GB.

Read full topic

item.title: I is be needing rig
item.dc:creator: @Tree_Climber Tree_Climber
item.description:
@Tree_Climber wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:7, topic:300396”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=396677.msg2946305#msg2946305 date=1252242619]
wheres your power supply? scrap the optical drive and the OS.

CPU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103649 [125$]

GPU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814150394 [145$]

Mobo: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813128392 [80$]

Ram: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231190 [78$]

HDD: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148395 [60$]

Case & PSU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811156098 [90$]

Total: 578$ (543$ using rebates)

122$ left over, buy an OS if you really have to… This rig is far better performance and quality parts than the one you picked out.
[/quote]
Yeah thats a great rig and all but the graphics card wont last long…[61c at idle? shit]

It seems like I’ll swap to that but, will the 500w psu supply that card or a 260gtx?

@cooper: thats with vista and not with xp

Edit: on the bright side, that nigger case has 4 fans[/quote]
if you dont have xp 64 than it will only do 3gigs.

la­wl:

get vista 64, apparently its a lot better than xp64. or just get windows 7

both vista64 and xp64 suck dick

Read full topic

item.title: I is be needing rig
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:18, topic:300396”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=396677.msg2947898#msg2947898 date=1252310927]

if its a 32 bit os, you cant use more than 4gb ram.

ok so what happens if i get a 64bit xp

you can use up to 32 or somethin

i thought it was something silly like 128
[/quote]
No I’m pretty sure its 32gigs

But whats the dealio? Why can’t I get a 64bit xp and get 6gigs
Or if I get a 32bit can I use 4gigs?[/quote]
32bit is like 3.6GB RAM cutoff point so you will lose some and you can go 64bit and get 6gigs but 64bitXP is shit and you have to have 64bit processor and what not

The emergence of the 64-bit architecture effectively increases the memory ceiling to 264 addresses, equivalent to approximately 17.2 billion gigabytes, 16.8 million terabytes, or 16 exabytes of RAM

Read full topic

item.title: I is be needing rig
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:8, topic:300396”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=396677.msg2946768#msg2946768 date=1252258935]

wheres your power supply? scrap the optical drive and the OS.

CPU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819103649 [125$]

GPU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814150394 [145$]

Mobo: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813128392 [80$]

Ram: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231190 [78$]

HDD: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822148395 [60$]

Case & PSU: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811156098 [90$]

Total: 578$ (543$ using rebates)

122$ left over, buy an OS if you really have to… This rig is far better performance and quality parts than the one you picked out.

Yeah thats a great rig and all but the graphics card wont last long…[61c at idle? shit]

It seems like I’ll swap to that but, will the 500w psu supply that card or a 260gtx?

@cooper: thats with vista and not with xp

Edit: on the bright side, that nigger case has 4 fans
[/quote]
don’t worry about temperatures, no matter how hot shit gets, if you don’t overclock your going to be fine. As for that 500w PSU, i’m honestly not sure how much that will handle, i have a similar rig but GTX260+ and it runs fine on a cheap 550w[/quote]
Yeah I might buy that case w/ psu and swap for my main pc’s 650w with that 500w [9800gt]

And I have a 300w psu from my old rig so what should I do with it?

Read full topic

Yeah thats a great rig and all but the graphics card wont last long…[61c at idle? shit]

It seems like I’ll swap to that but, will the 500w psu supply that card or a 260gtx?

@cooper: thats with vista and not with xp

Edit: on the bright side, that nigger case has 4 fans[/quote]
don’t worry about temperatures, no matter how hot shit gets, if you don’t overclock your going to be fine. As for that 500w PSU, i’m honestly not sure how much that will handle, i have a similar rig but GTX260+ and it runs fine on a cheap 550w
